texts: Occasionally you may want to use a hire or courtesy car for a short period, for example when your own car is being repaired or serviced.

You can still qualify for the discount but you will need to pay the charge at the normal daily rate while using the vehicle. You can then apply for a refund of the difference between what you've paid and what you would have paid if you had had the discount at the time.
Contact us by email or phone to let us know the number plate of the hire/courtesy vehicle, the date you intend to start using it and the date you expect to return it.

Remember to claim your refund within 30 days of returning the car. You will need to upload or send in a copy of the hire agreement, showing it was hired in your name. If you were using a courtesy car, you will need to send a letter on headed paper from a recognised insurance company or garage.

For a limited time, residents registered for the residents' Congestion Charge discount will not have to pay ULEZ charges on their residents' discount vehicles.
Residents using a vehicle that doesn't meet the T-Charge emissions standards will continue to pay the T-Charge, at a discounted rate of 90%, during this grace period.
From 25 October 2021, residents must pay the full daily ULEZ charge to drive a vehicle within the zone if it does not meet the ULEZ standards. Check if your vehicle meets the standards.
